definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: However, aerogels tend to be extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 然而，气凝胶往往非常易碎。

sentences.english: This is because connections are vulnerable to breaking due to the flexible screen.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为由于柔性荧光屏易碎致使连接脆弱。

sentences.english: The product that combines aluminum and resin is non-breakable and light.
sentences.chinese: 该产品结合了铝和树脂是不易碎，重量轻。

sentences.english: As this article is fragile, be sure to put enough padding.
sentences.chinese: 此物易碎，请务必装入足够之填充物。

sentences.english: This glass dish is very fragile.
Believe in me . I will take care of your fragile heart .
sentences.chinese: 相信我，我会小心翼翼去呵护你那易碎的心。

sentences.english: The only problem is that it's fragile and brittle, and that means it breaks easily.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的毛病在于它脆弱而易碎，也就是说很容易坏掉。

sentences.english: The photographs by Jock Sturges possess a fragile equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 斯滕格斯的摄影所拥有的就是一种易碎的均衡。

sentences.english: The Chinese must be a delicate people.
sentences.chinese: 中国人是一个纤巧易碎的人种。

sentences.english: Is there anything valuables or frangible (breakable) in your luggage?
sentences.chinese: 请问行李里有贵重和易碎的物品吗？

sentences.english: Don't place breakables on unstable tables.
sentences.chinese: 不要将易碎物品放在不稳的桌子上。

sentences.english: The glasses in the box are fragile.
sentences.chinese: 箱子里的玻璃杯是易碎品。

sentences.english: Please be careful, some of them are breakable.
The cashew apple grows in Brazil and it cannot be transported due to its fragility.
sentences.chinese: 酪梨苹果生长在巴西，因其果实易碎而不能运输。

sentences.english: Ceramics are extremely difficult to machine because of their high hardness and brittleness.
sentences.chinese: 然而由于陶瓷的高硬度及其易碎性使其难于加工。

sentences.english: If only bad habits could be broken as easily as hearts!
sentences.chinese: 但愿坏习惯象心一样易碎。

definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
to knock against/to bump into/to have a disagreement/to clash
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
